headline.print_headline: Early Deaths Linked to China’s Air Pollution Totaled 1.2 Million in 2010, Data Shows
headline.seo: Air Pollution Linked to 1.2 Million Deaths in China
headline.main: Air Pollution Linked to 1.2 Million Premature Deaths in China

docs.abstract: Ambitious 2010 Global Burden of Disease Study, which was published in The Lancet medical journals, contains data that indicates outdoor air pollution contributed to 1.2 million premature deaths in China in 2010, nearly 40 percent of global total.
docs.lead_paragraph: Air pollution was the fourth leading risk factor for deaths in China, accounting for the loss of 25 million healthy years of life from the population, a study said.
docs.snippet: Air pollution was the fourth leading risk factor for deaths in China, accounting for the loss of 25 million healthy years of life from the population, a study said.
